item.title: Report X-2023090551
item.description:
Report X-2023090551

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX IS WET AND RIPPED/TORN ON ONE SIDE. INSIDE, BOTH BOTTLES ARE STAINED. ONE BOTTLE HAS A MISALIGNED CAP AND A BROKEN SEAL. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS ALIGNED AND TIGHTENED. ALL MATERIALS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIPTIED.

item.title: Report X-2023090538
item.description:
Report X-2023090538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received from unload unit to QA work area with bottom of box saturated in an unknown liquid substance. The package was placed in a black plastic container housing the leaking liquid substance coming from the bottom of package. DescribePack: Upon opening the package with regulate PPE in place there were liquid solution coming from one of four plastic gallon bottles. The top was not secured tight contributing t liquid leakage from bottle throughout the package and other remaining contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in a plastic container

item.title: Report X-2023090535
item.description:

  • City: LUBBOCK

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet on one side and was immediately removed from delivery process DescribePack: the 20 liter capacity box was wet so was the 10 liters one inside it. There was a very small hole at the bottom of the 5L bottle where the peroxyacetic acid mixtures was slowly leaking and nothing could stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the delivery process and was put into designated damage hazmat packages containers.

item.title: Report E-2023100036
item.description:
Report E-2023100036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN1866 L010-PPA-33 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces of material released to the tote body only due to a puncture on the top corner of the tote caused by an unknown source. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged empty tote was then patched and poly sheeting was placed over the tote for disposal. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090773
item.description:
Report E-2023090773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2023 one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured while in transit and released approximately less-than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from OMI/E3 to remediate the impacted site. OMI/E3 did not observed any released material on the pallet or trailer floor. The crew placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum for transport and disposal. OMI/E3 staged the material onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023090409
item.description:
Report X-2023090409

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090409 SequenceEvent: A discoloration of the packaging was noticed before being loaded on Saturday morning, pkg was brought to QA for inspection. QA inspected box and contents of the box. DescribePack: Loose cap is the cause of the failure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: item was placed in a designated bin and set in the upright position to prevent further leakage. 2. X-2023090411 SequenceEvent: discoloration on repackaged box notice during unloading, pkg was placed in upright position then taken to qa for inspection, pkg was inspected, contents of pkg was inspected DescribePack: Inspection of pkg shows the failure was loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pkg was set in the direction of the orientation arrows.

item.title: Report X-2023090388
item.description:
Report X-2023090388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged during preload where it was then placed in front of the hazmat cage for it to be looked at. When box was inspected the package was in a tote, when it was opened at the top the and the packing material was removed one of the four glass bottles had a loose cap on it the other bottles were all tight. When I lifted the bottle with the loose cap on it up, you could see a cup of liquid was gone from the glass bottle. When I removed all of the glass bottles from the box, I lifted the package up and saw one of the bottom flaps had come open. DescribePack: one of the bottles of isopropanol had a loose cap and the others didn't. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors, fans on and package was to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090387
item.description:
Report X-2023090387

  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Was found leaking during transit and driver gave it to QA; package had no hazmat markings, hazmat labels, or was not declare a hazmat DescribePack: Both cans inside box was hitting/rubbing up on each other during transit that cause friction for one of the cans to leak from it's seal DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Took package away from VSA/QA and got in a salvage drum asap

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of sealer (un1263) damaging one of the metal inner 1 gallon can and releasing 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.description:
Report X-2023090351

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped by pickoff on load side 2 by door 118, cracking the bottom. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injuries. DescribePack: Package was dropped by pickoff, cracking the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injuries.

item.title: Report X-2023090324
item.description:
Report X-2023090324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at the end of the 300 line, with visible liquid damage from inner bottles. all three container have loose caps due to the pressure from another package, which has caused the leakage.. DescribePack: all caps from the bottles have been cracked and loosened. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was put into a tote to prevent any other leakage from package.
